A lavish gadget-laden railroad car called the "Nimrod" housed & transported this show's heroes

Its lyrics include "We always take my car 'cause it's never been beat, and we've never missed yet with the girls we meet"

Book that ends, "...Aunt Sally, she's going to adopt me and sivilize me and I can't stand it. I been there before"

This 1892 Leoncavallo opera ends with "La commedia e finita", or "The comedy is finished"

It's nothing to write home about, but the hollow spines on a hedgehog are called these
You may have noticed that this planet isn't on the same ecliptic plane as the others in the solar system
The eggs of the Japanese species of this small game bird were studied on the Mir Space Station
The Titanic sank with its artifacts to 12,500 feet, where this is measured at about 380 atmospheres
Sadly, James Joyce died before these hypothetical particles were named for a word he used in "Finnegans Wake"

In Sept. 1914, in the Battle of this river near Paris, French reinforcements were sped to the front in taxicabs

We should see a light bulb above your head if you know that this man's middle name was Alva
John F. Kennedy's middle name was Fitzgerald & Robert F. Kennedy's was this

rounds.comments: (Alex: And each correct response will be a letter of the alphabet. We don't want a word; we want a letter.)

clues.text: Add this letter to rim & it becomes the rim of a hat
When is a surgeon like a fish?--When you add this letter to it
Add this letter to crate & it becomes a big bowl-shaped depression
This letter turns a pony into a flower
Add this letter to plant & it becomes easily bent

In 1921 this big wheel rode to his inauguration in a Packard Twin Six convertible
A special luncheon at the 1901 Expo in Buffalo for this president's wife went on without her
President in the 1850s, his name inspired a comic strip about a duck
2004 is the bicentennial year of this president born in Hillsboro, New Hampshire
A sonnet by this poet ends, "And, if God choose, I shall but love thee better after death"
"Welcome to the World, Baby Girl!" is a recent book by this Southern novelist & TV personality
"The Window" & "Time Passes" are sections of her stream-of-consciousness novel "To the Lighthouse"
"Middlemarch" is one of her masterpieces
Her 1899 book "The Awakening" shocked critics with its frankness about women's emotional lives

rounds.text: Found in Article 3, Section 3, & requiring the testimony of 2 witnesses to prove, it's the only crime defined in the Constitution
